name: El Simons
bio:
El is a Belgian actor who settled in London after drama school. They have experience in musical theatre, theatre, film, tv and opera as well as production work and are currently part of the National Youth Theatre.

Training: Mountview, Fontys, De! Kunsthumaniora, RITCS

Credits in training: Medium Alison in Fun Home (Mountview), Charity in Sweet Charity (Mountview)

Theatre: Ada (NYT), La Fête (The Glory)

Concert: Dreaming Of MT (Union Theatre)

Film: Annette

Other: Hold The Hope, Stranger Things: The Experience, De Ideale Wereld, The Odyssey: Part V (workshop at The National)

name: Joy Tan
bio:
Joy Tan trained at the Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts and the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. They are part of Showstopper! The Improvised Musical who tour and perform across the UK.

Work in theatre includes: Jungle Rumble at the Fortune; A-Typical Rainbow at the Turbine; The Crucible at the Olivier and at the Gielgud; George Takei’s Allegiance at the Charing Cross and Pacific Overtures at the Menier Chocolate Factory. Workshops include Witches with Lyndsey Turner, Dave Malloy and Lucy Kirkwood.

name: Freddie Love
bio:
Freddie Love (they/them) is a multifaceted artist whose talents span the realms of acting, writing, musical theatre, opera, and drag. Originally from Oklahoma USA, Freddie clawed their way off the farm and on to the stage. From the West End to queer basement theatre, Freddie has captivated audiences worldwide.

Their credits include: Just For One Day (The Old Vic), But I’m A Cheerleader (Turbine Theatre), Classical Drag (Here at Outernet), Fierce Love (Cockpit Theatre), Gatsby (Southwark Playhouse), Sex, Drag & Opera (King’s Head Theatre), and Queer Cowboys (Wilton’s Music Hall). Their solo show Queer Cowboys will be returning to the King’s Head Theatre later this summer.

name: Laoi Curtin
bio:
Laoi Curtin(they/them) is an Irish non-binary performer based in London. They acquired their BFA Musical Theatre from American College Dublin in 2022.

Credits in training: Molly in One Touch of Venus, Narrator in Into The Woods, Marmee in Little Women (The Broadway Musical), Candace in Image of an Unknown Young Woman.

Upcoming: Laoi will be performing in Canadh (a celebration of Irish trained, London based talent) on July 29th at the Phoenix Arts Club.

name: Beth Graham
bio:
Beth is a proudly queer and neurodivergent musical theatre actor, director and performance maker.

Recent acting credits include: Audrey in All the Fraudulent Horse Girls(The Glory, Seven Dials Playhouse, National Theatre River Stage), Dingus in In The Basement, and Clara in Couple Fight (The Glory). They are currently preparing to spend the summer horsin' around in the fourth revival of All the Fraudulent Horse Girls, which will play at the Pleasance Dome, Edinburgh Fringe, from 31st July-26th Aug.

name: Ashley Goh
bio:
Training: Savi Arts, New Earth Theatre, ArtsEd, Mountview

Theatre: Babies (The Other Palace), Babies (The Lyric Theatre), FURY & ELYSIUM (The Other Palace Studio), The Phase (The Vaults), Red Riding Hood (Theatre Royal Stratford East)

Concerts: REPRESENTASIAN (Phoenix Arts Theatre), The Chamber Musical Sessions (Garrick Theatre), PRIDE at the Palace (The Palace Theatre)

Film: Divine Intervention (dir. Ravenna Tran), Aetherium (dir. Livvy Edwards)

Audio drama: Trice Forgotten (Rusty Quill)

name: Rachel Blaquière
bio:
Rachel Blaquière is a 25-year-old musical director, composer, and pianist, as well as a fellow member of the queer community as a lesbian trans woman. She trained at Edinburgh University and Mountview and now freelances as a musician and tutor.

Musical direction credits include: Divas: From Stage to Screen, Big Band Does Broadway (BBD Productions); 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee, Alice, Mill on the Floss (Italia Conti); God Save The Kink (King's Head Theatre); Pinocchio (Georgian Theatre Royal); Sunshine on Leith (Captivate Theatre). Composing credits include: All the Fraudulent Horse Girls, In the Basement, (Brooklyn Rep UK); Cosmic Odyssey Cannes (Boo Productions); Tap of the Reverie (London Film School, dir. Asia Alselmi); Of Dysphoria and Blood (dir. Hazel Magnoni); The Wind in the Willows, The Wicked Lady (Frankfurt Youth Theatre).

name: Ro West
bio:
Ro West (they/them) is a disabled queer soundie turned stage manager turned all round technical busy body. With qualifications in technical sound and stage management as well as far too many questions for technical theatre teams, they are always eager to put their knowledge to practice.

Credits include: Lighting Designer on Fuckboy at Riverside Studios and Riverside Studios, Sound No. 2 Dep on The Comeuppance at The Almeida, ASM Book Cover on Wedding Band at The Lyric Hammersmith, SM on Book on Wendy and Peter Pan at The Mack, CSM on Book on There’s No Place Like Grove at The Tabernacle, DSM on Ragedom at The Courtyard Theatre, Sound No. 1 on Faking Bad at The Turbine Theatre, Stage Manager on Ikaria at Abbey Theatre, Stage Manager on Climate Cabaret at Fusebox, Sound No. 2 on Bring it On at The Mack, DSM on Romeo and Juliet at The Drum, Theatre Royal Plymouth, CSM on Book / Sound No. 1 on Halls at Turbine Theatre, Backstage Dep (CSM Plot) on Eugenius at Turbine Theatre, SM on Book on Scritches #1 at The Glory, CSM on Book on Charlie and the Everlasting Gobstopper at The Tabernacle, Sound Designer and Operator on Trojans ‘22 at The Playground Theatre and Big Ideas Literature and Life Stages FT Weekend Festival, SM on Book on Legally Blonde at The Mack, ASM on Yeast Nation - The Triumph of Life at The Large, Southwark Playhouse.

name: Joe Vaughan
bio: Joe is a writer, improviser, and web designer. Previously he worked at The Museum of English Rural Life and did funny tweets. His work has appeared in The Guardian, NPR, BBC, and on BBC Radio. He can make websites for you just like this one.
